title: Global automotive industry : capacity and assembly volume 2015/2022
summary: This grouped bar chart represents 2 different Countrys on X-axis for 6 groups North America, EU, Eastern Europe, Asia-Pacific, Middle East & Africa, and South America. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Capacity in million units.
Country 2022 had the maximum Capacity in million units among all 6 groups, and it was for Asia-Pacific. The minimum Capacity in million units was observed in Country 2015 for Middle East & Africa.
There is a gap of 11.0 between the highest and lowest Capacity in million units found for Eastern Europe in Country 2022 and 2015.

On average, the Country 2022 had the highest Capacity in million units for all 6 groups North America, EU, Eastern Europe, Asia-Pacific, Middle East & Africa, and South America. Whereas 2015 had the lowest average Capacity in million units.
min_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Capacity in million units on the Y-axis for 2 different Countrys for 6 groups North America, EU, Eastern Europe, Asia-Pacific, Middle East & Africa, and South America that are presented on the X-axis.
Country 2022 had the maximum Capacity in million units among all 6 groups, and it was for Asia-Pacific. The minimum Capacity in million units was observed in Country 2015 for Middle East & Africa.
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 2 different Countrys on X-axis for 6 groups North America, EU, Eastern Europe, Asia-Pacific, Middle East & Africa, and South America. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Capacity in million units.
Country 2022 had the maximum Capacity in million units among all 6 groups, and it was for Asia-Pacific. The minimum Capacity in million units was observed in Country 2015 for Middle East & Africa.
There is a gap of 11.0 between the highest and lowest Capacity in million units found for Eastern Europe in Country 2022 and 2015.

On average, the Country 2022 had the highest Capacity in million units for all 6 groups North America, EU, Eastern Europe, Asia-Pacific, Middle East & Africa, and South America. Whereas 2015 had the lowest average Capacity in million units.
max_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 2 different Countrys on X-axis for 6 groups North America, EU, Eastern Europe, Asia-Pacific, Middle East & Africa, and South America. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Capacity in million units.
For Country 2022, Asia-Pacific had the highest Capacity in million units 770.0 among the 6 groups and in 2015, Middle East & Africa had the lowest Capacity in million units 37.0.
For Country 2022, Eastern Europe had the highest Capacity in million units among all 2 Countrys and it has the lowest Capacity in million units in Country 2015.
Country 2022 and 2015 had the biggest gap of 11.0 between the highest and lowest Capacity in million units found for Eastern Europe.
Among all 6 groups, Asia-Pacific had the gap of 89.0 between the maximum and minimum Capacity in million units observed in Country 2022 and 2015 respectively.

In case of Country 2022, Asia-Pacific had the highest Capacity in million units 770.0 among the 6 groups and in 2015, Middle East & Africa had the lowest Capacity in million units 37.0. The second highest Capacity in million units 64.0 was observed for Asia-Pacific in Country 2022.

Averaging all 6 groups North America, EU, Eastern Europe, Asia-Pacific, Middle East & Africa, and South America, the Country 2022 is the maximum Capacity in million units and 2015 is the minimum Capacity in million units.
